verbs.description: disgown (third-person singular simple present disgowns, present participle disgowning, simple past and past participle disgowned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To divest of a gown of office; to defrock.
examples: The boldness with which Dr. Canfield defied Bishop Potter when the latter threatened to disgown him for such transgressions was simply an expression of a right to individual action under the impulse of conviction of duty to the truth.
